alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:04AM CST until January 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Cherokee, Nacogdoches, Smith and Rusk Counties. For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mud Creek near Jacksonville. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of timber resources along with some farmland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Thursday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 05/12/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1115 AM CST.
